headline: House candidate storms out of GOP event, accusing fellow Republicans of
sentences:
He's the silly-billy who released a campaign video over the summer in which he explodedwith an assault riflea pile of papers that read Nancy Pelosi's Plan for America,? and another bearing the term RINO.?
Since Jones' announcement earlier in February, Collins has been trashing Jones in all the ways you might imagine a Republican going after a Black Republican might.

On Saturday night, The Atlanta Journal-Constitution Greg Bluestein reported that Mr. Jones was super unhappy emoji face about what he called GOP poli-tricks.? The tricks were, according to Jones, a last-minute switcheroo of speaking positions between himself and GOP candidate for District 10, Mike Collins, at a Jackson County event.

Rabun County (GA) Republican Party (@RabunGOP) March 6, 2022
The chairman of the Jackson County Republican Party took time away from tweeting bad math to misinform the public about COVID-19 to speak with AJC: To clarify, this was a private GOP fundraiser in Jackson County, not an official Jackson County GOP event.

https://t.co/iXzJgISeoz pic.twitter.com/lkc26v40sV
 Michael Collins (@MikeCollinsGA) February 8, 2022
In the video from last night, Jones claims that a coin was tossed to choose which candidate would speak first and which would speak last.

In fact, Jones has tried to brand himself the Black Donald Trump.? The political calculation seems to be that, with his spotty past, his one chance at gaining power is to act as the tip of the spear for Trump's GOP in Georgia.

Now a blame game has arisen, with some in Jackson County feeling like Jones' statement and the vagueness of how GOP events are set up has led to them taking the blame for whatever indignity may or may not have happened.

This multi-candidate event may have happened within Jackson County but the local party had nothing to do with it, didn't organize it, didn't rent the venue, and was not responsible for the order of the speakers.

Local GOP chair TJ Dearman told me his organization will hold a forum for 10th [District] candidates on April 16, and will welcome all contenders with open arms.'?
What happened after Jones left the event?
Former Georgia state representative Vernon Jones went from being a moderate Democrat to a MAGA-loving Republican seemingly overnight; he even announced his change of parties on Jan. 6, 2021.

x
Former Democrat Vernon Jones - now a Trump-backed candidate in Georgia's 10th District  walks out of a Jackson County GOP event last night  because he was mad about the speaking order.
This led to Jones jumping ship on his gubernatorial run and turning his attention toward becoming the next representative from District 10, an area of Georgia in which he does not live.
Jones called this unfair because everywhere in the Peach State, when he was speaking with groups that included Collins, Collins would use the second position to trash Jones.
Mikey Collins, you might remember, is the Washington outsider? whose dad, Mac Collins, was in Georgia's Senate and a Georgia's Congressperson for about 16 years.
Shortly after turning his attention away from the GOP gubernatorial race, Donald Trump gave one of his patented poorly lit video-taped endorsements for Jones.
It turns out that the predominantly white Republican Party in Georgia is nowhere near as interested in Trump's Black MAGA man? as Trump wants them to be.

Here's an example:
x
The voters of GA10 don't want a corrupt, carpetbagging, lifelong Democrat from DeKalb County accused of rape representing them.
Yes, the same day that the world was presented with a sight-and-sound exhibition of MAGA fascism and a failed coup d'etat of the U.S. government.
A couple of months later, Jones made a new announcement: He would be running in the GOP primary as a challenger to Georgia's governor Brian Kemp.
Jones' career has long been a hot messincluding rape allegations, accusations of bullying, as well as campaign contribution violations.
Outsider? Mike Collins spoke about Trump's endorsement of Jones, saying, ?Donald Trump didn't endorse Vernon Jones to run for Congress.
Advertising dollars have been gobbled up by Big Tech and cash-strapped outlets are being bought and sold to the highest bidder.
They want a pro-Trump, America 1st fighter who's lived, worked and raised a family in the districtit's why we're going to win.
And if he can ride Trump's popularity in District 10, an area that Trump carried with 74% of the vote in 2020, he might win.
We are primarily accountable to readers like you because donations from readers like you are our biggest source of income.

#gapol #ga10 pic.twitter.com/jl8S8gCl68
 Greg Bluestein (@bluestein) March 6, 2022
Uh oh!
That's not just journalists, but fact-checkers, editors, and administrative staff.
After some back and forth, Jones left the event without giving his speech.
At the last minute, he says, Collins was given the chance to speak second.
But Jones has one thing going for him: his open adoration of Donald Trump.
We don't have corporate backers that are only in it for the bottom line.
It has been less than a month since Jones received Trump's endorsement.

x
Why is the @GOPJackson being tarred & feathered with this debacle?
He wouldn't have cared if Vernon Jones ran for dog catcher.? Teehee.

It's important:
 Media outlets shed 28,637 jobs last year alone.
He endorsed Vernon Jones to get out of that governor's race.
Speaking second, Jones did not have an opportunity to rebut.
